items.sentence: There\'s no doubt Tom is the one who stole Mary\'s necklace.
Tom thinks his country is the greatest country in the world.
Tom told her that he had written that poem two years before.
Tom told me that he thinks Mary is much prettier than Alice.
I carefully considered my options before making my decision.
After the rain had let up a bit, we made a dash for the car.
After you finish reading the book, put it back where it was.
Tom might\'ve known the answer, but he didn\'t say anything.
Tom is sure that Mary didn\'t really go to Boston last week.
Tom is worried because he should\'ve heard from Mary by now.
Tom left at 2:30, so he should\'ve arrived in Boston by now.
Tom doesn\'t know the difference between wine and champagne.
Tom doesn\'t want his parents to find out that he was drunk.
Tom found Christmas presents hidden under his parents\' bed.
Mary is only taller than Tom when she\'s wearing high heels.
You know as well as I do that Tom isn\'t a very good singer.
You\'d better examine the contract carefully before signing.
All Tom wanted was for Mary to learn to get along with John.
Do you think you could convince Tom to volunteer to do that?
It\'s not such a big problem. You\'re worrying way too much.
Tom is looking for somebody to teach French to his children.
Tom is never going to be given the chance to do that, is he?
Tom is probably planning on staying in Boston until October.
Tom is rich enough to do just about anything he wants to do.
Tom is the only member of the baseball team that Mary knows.
Tom assumes Mary will be willing to help with the bake sale.
Tom ate the delicious meal and thought he must be in heaven.
Tom said he would be going to Boston on business next month.
Tom said that he had expected something different to happen.
If you want something done right, you should do it yourself.
I just don\'t want you to do something you\'ll be sorry for.
I don\'t want Tom to be in the room while I\'m on the phone.
I don\'t want to go and I know you don\'t want to go either.
Every Monday, I have a face-to-face meeting with my manager.
Everyone in the room checked their watches at the same time.
Everyone says that the food at this restaurant is very good.
Have you thought about what we talked about the other night?
How could you just walk out the door without saying goodbye?
I bought this book at the bookstore in front of the station.
Tom reached into the fridge and pulled out a bottle of beer.
Tom spent the whole day working on his French pronunciation.
Tom used to live in the same apartment building as I do now.
Tom explained it to me, but I still couldn\'t understand it.
Tom has asked us to help him get ready for tonight\'s party.
Tom hid the children\'s Christmas presents behind the couch.
What are you doing sitting here in the dark all by yourself?
What did you and Tom do the last time you hung out together?
What really surprised me most about Tom was how tall he was.
Tom tried to talk Mary out of going, but he wasn\'t able to.
Tom will just have to ask Mary to do that for us, won\'t he?
